title: sounding typeface donation (8 hours left)
content:
Dear Typophiles,

I donated an experimental display typeface to my favorite web-radio-station [dublab](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115/http:/www.dublab.com/protondrive/).

But I'm not really helping them with their fund-racer without putting some music loving type-designers on this subject. So I should do some rude self-promotion: By donating an amount over 50$ you will get a price-package in retune which as well contains an exclusive mix-cd by dublab-dj [Jimmy Tamborello](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115/http:/www.jimmytamborello.com/) (a.k.a. Dntel, The Postal Service, James Figurine).

I originally designed this font for the audio-visual exhibition [Into Infinity](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115/http:/www.intoinfinity.org/). My contribution is also posted on my [frontpage](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115/http:/www.ewalthert.com/).

My sounding Typeface:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SonicWaves_abc400_5967.jpg)

And the funny thing, it will come with a folder of sound-files:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203024115im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SoundEditor_3894.png)
author: ewalthert

comments.content:
haha nice one. i tried doing something similar - mapping adsrs and lfos to serif contours etc... needless to say it flopped

well done
